data_description.host: Hostname or IP address of the receiver.

data_description.volume_resolution: Number of steps it takes for the receiver to go from the lowest to the highest possible volume.
data_description.input_sources: List of input sources supported by the receiver.

error.empty_input_source_list: Input source list cannot be empty

abort.unique_id_mismatch: The serial number of the device does not match the previous serial number

data_description.max_volume: Maximum volume limit as a percentage. This will associate Home Assistant's maximum volume to this value on the receiver, i.e., if you set this to 50%, then setting the volume to 100% in Home Assistant will cause the volume on the receiver to be set to 50% of its maximum value.

deprecated_yaml_import_issue_no_discover.title: The Onkyo YAML configuration import failed
deprecated_yaml_import_issue_no_discover.description:
Configuring Onkyo using YAML is being removed but no receivers were discovered when importing your YAML configuration.

Ensure the connection to the receiver works and restart Home Assistant to try again or remove the Onkyo YAML configuration from your configuration.yaml file and continue to [set up the integration]({url}) manually.

deprecated_yaml_import_issue_cannot_conn.title: The Onkyo YAML configuration import failed
deprecated_yaml_import_issue_cannot_conn.description:
Configuring Onkyo using YAML is being removed but there was a connection error when importing your YAML configuration for host {host}.

Ensure the connection to the receiver works and restart Home Assistant to try again or remove the Onkyo YAML configuration from your configuration.yaml file and continue to [set up the integration]({url}) manually.

invalid_source.message: Cannot select input source "{invalid_source}" for entity: {entity_id}.
